descbody.para: The operator will choose the right tool depending on:

ul.li: access to the work area : flat; at an angle; in a corner,
the environment where the welding overlap is located : sensitive to splashes or not,
the position in the sheet stacking for unpicking : primary or secondary,
the type of material for working : mastic, adhesive or sheets.

descbody.para: By definition, these tools must remove all paint protections from the body panel without damaging the material.

noteR.para: This is only possible on metal parts. For plastic components, you must be careful not to damage the support (see details in the procedures).

ul.li: In the phase of removing welded components, the idea is to locate the spot welds to be able to unpick them. It is not necessary to strip the components completely.
In the pre-assembly phase, the mating surfaces on the vehicle and new part must be stripped to prepared the surfaces for assembly.

descbody.para: By definition these tools are used to remove particles of a material that constitutes the body component, during unwelding, grinding or cutting operations.

noteR.para: According to the grit used, some of them can also be used for stripping, but do not lose their ability to remove metal particles.
In this case, as for plastic components, you must be careful not to damage the support (see details in the procedures).

descbody.para: For the correct use of these tools with equipment fitted with speed reduction, it is essential to observe the rotating speeds indicated: either on the label on the "consumable tools" themselves (grinders or discs), or in equipment catalogues for "cutting" tools (burrs or drill bits).
